            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

parent.<!----></span><br>I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<span class="line"><!---->I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<!----></span><br><br>Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from its parent:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through"         Merge approved: your change passed merge requirements and is auto-approved for M105. Please go ahead and merge the CL to branch 5195 (refs/branch-heads/5195) manually. <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>3dbd64384ceafe88142424c0d877b749a1cc0616<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/3dbd64384ceafe88142424c0d877b749a1cc0616"><!---->3dbd64384ceafe88142424c0d877b749a1cc0616<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jul 28 14:26:27 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jul 28 14:26:27 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3"><!---->b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 11 19:29:32 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 11 19:29:32 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span           flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          min-width: 256px;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Note: you have to click in the tab.<span class="line"><!---->Note: you have to click in the tab.<!----></span><br><br>On HEAD I hit this DCHECK:- <span class="line"><!---->On HEAD I hit this DCHECK:- <!----></span><br><br>third_party\blink\renderer\core\dom\layout_tree_builder_traversal.cc:56<span class="line"><!---->third_party\blink\renderer\core\dom\layout_tree_builder_traversal.cc:56<!----></span><br>ContainerNode* LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::Parent(const Node& node) {<span class="line"><!---->ContainerNode* LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::Parent(const Node&amp; node) {<!----></span><br>  // TODO(hayato): Uncomment this once we can be sure<span class="line"><!---->  // TODO(hayato): Uncomment this once we can be sure<!----></span><br>  // LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::parent() is used only for a node which is<span class="line"><!---->  // LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::parent() is used only for a node which is<!----></span><br>  // connected.<span class="line"><!---->  // connected.<!----></span><br>  // DCHECK(node.isConnected());<span class="line"><!---->  // DCHECK(node.isConnected());<!----></span><br>  if (auto* element = DynamicTo<PseudoElement>(node)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (auto* element = DynamicTo&lt;PseudoElement&gt;(node)) {<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(node.parentNode());<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(node.parentNode());<!----></span><br>    return node.parentNode();<span class="line"><!---->    return node.parentNode();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  return FlatTreeTraversal::Parent(node);<span class="line"><!---->  return FlatTreeTraversal::Parent(node);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>I assume in a release build we will pass the dcheck and something bad will happen.<span class="line"><!---->I assume in a release build we will pass the dcheck and something bad will happen.<!----></span><br><br>Sev:high - rce<span class="line"><!---->Sev:high - rce<!----></span><br>FoundIn-102 as oldest released version.<span class="line"><!---->FoundIn-102 as oldest released version.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338135" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free html_element.cc:1802 in blink::HTMLElement::offsetTopForBindin"><!---->Fixed: is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1. Level of complexity (High, Medium, Low - Explain)<!----></span><br>3. Has this been merged to a stable release? beta release?<span class="line"><!---->3.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<span class="line"><!---->The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<!----></span><br>I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<span class="line"><!---->I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<!----></span><br><br>Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from its parent:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from         jarhar: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->jarhar: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338135" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free html_element.cc:1802 in blink::HTMLElement::offsetTopForBindin"><!---->Fixed: 1338135<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I07790658e25ea9fe2f4e8de154e3a58e7e08892b<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I07790658e25ea9fe2f4e8de154e3a58e7e08892b<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jul 28 14:26:27 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jul 28 14:26:27 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.         The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<span class="line"><!---->The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<!----></span><br>I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<span class="line"><!---->I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<!----></span><br><br>Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from its parent:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3"><!---->b937ed2c29ef897a844d88783cb2abf3b9f2dcd3<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 11 19:29:32 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 11 19:29:32 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Aug 19 11:07:51 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 19 11:07:51 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M96-LTS] Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->[M96-LTS] Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338135" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free html_element.cc:1802 in blink::HTMLElement::offsetTopForBindin"><!---->Fixed: 1338135<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I07790658e25ea9fe2f4e8de154e3a58e7e08892b<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I07790658e25ea9fe2f4e8de154e3a58e7e08892b<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3751710<a         }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>

        The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<span class="line"><!---->The DCHECK is being hit because there is a ::backdrop pseudo element with no parent.<!----></span><br>I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<span class="line"><!---->I'm guessing that pseudo elements are always supposed to have a parent...?<!----></span><br><br>Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from its parent:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the stack trace for where the ::backdrop is removed from its parent:<!----></span><br>#0 0x7fb21f96e469 base::debug::CollectStackTrace() class="line"><!---->I tried not removing pseudo elements in DetachDescendantTopLayerElements, but that didn't help.<!----></span><br>I tried avoiding creating a ::backdrop on DisplayLocked elements, but it would seem that the problematic ::backdrop is created before the element actually gets DisplayLocked.<span class="line"><!---->I tried avoiding creating a ::backdrop on DisplayLocked elements, but it would seem that the problematic ::backdrop is created before the element actually gets DisplayLocked.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through" during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         Note: you have to click in the tab.<span class="line"><!---->Note: you have to click in the tab.<!----></span><br><br>On HEAD I hit this DCHECK:- <span class="line"><!---->On HEAD I hit this DCHECK:- <!----></span><br><br>third_party\blink\renderer\core\dom\layout_tree_builder_traversal.cc:56<span class="line"><!---->third_party\blink\renderer\core\dom\layout_tree_builder_traversal.cc:56<!----></span><br>ContainerNode* LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::Parent(const Node& node) {<span class="line"><!---->ContainerNode* LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::Parent(const Node&amp; node) {<!----></span><br>  // TODO(hayato): Uncomment this once we can be sure<span class="line"><!---->  // TODO(hayato): Uncomment this once we can be sure<!----></span><br>  // LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::parent() is used only for a node which is<span class="line"><!---->  // LayoutTreeBuilderTraversal::parent() is used only for a node which is<!----></span><br>  // connected.<span class="line"><!---->  // connected.<!----></span><br>  // DCHECK(node.isConnected());<span class="line"><!---->  // DCHECK(node.isConnected());<!----></span><br>  if (auto* element = DynamicTo<PseudoElement>(node)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (auto* element = DynamicTo&lt;PseudoElement&gt;(node)) {<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(node.parentNode());<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(node.parentNode());<!----></span><br>    return node.parentNode();<span class="line"><!---->    return node.parentNode();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  return FlatTreeTraversal::Parent(node);<span class="line"><!---->  return FlatTreeTraversal::Parent(node);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>I assume in a release build we will pass the dcheck and something bad will happen.<span class="line"><!---->I assume in a release build we will pass the dcheck and something bad will happen.<!----></span><br><br>Sev:high - rce<span class="line"><!---->Sev:high - rce<!----></span><br>FoundIn-102 as oldest released version.<span class="line"><!---->FoundIn-102 as oldest released version.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d"><!---->ab55fe05c2c37693afe5021aa637fb2d7491eb6d<!----></a><br>Author: Joey Arhar <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Joey Arhar &lt;<!----></span>jarhar@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jarhar@chromium.org"><!---->jarhar@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 26 19:42:57 2022<!----></span><br><br>Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<span class="line"><!---->Don't re-lock DisplayLocks during forced unlock<!----></span><br><br>When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<span class="line"><!---->When a DisplayLock is unlocked via ForceUnlockIfNeeded, subsequent<!----></span><br>updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<span class="line"><!---->updates to the DisplayLock can cause it to become locked again which is<!----></span><br>problematic.<span class="line"><!---->problematic.<!----></span><br><br>This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<span class="line"><!---->This patch prevents the DisplayLock from being locked again until the<!----></span><br>next frame.<span class="line"><!---->next frame.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1338135<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338135" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free html_element.cc:1802 in blink::HTMLElement::offsetTopForBindin"><!---->Fixed:
